qas.question: What happened to Estonia during WWII?
After the Soviet invasion what other language became the second official Estonian language?
What was another country with similar immigration patterns to post Soviet Estonia?
What became more intense in the 1970's in Estonia?
What country did not occupy Estonia?
What happened to Estonia during WWI from the Soviet Union?
What became more intense in the early 1970's in Estonia?
What is the third language of Estonia?
What language was terms the "language of enemy nations"?

context: When Estonia was <a0_0><b6_0>invaded and occupied<b6_0/><a0_0/> by the <a1_0><b5_0>Soviet Union<b5_0/><a1_0/> in World War II, the status of the Estonian language changed to the first of two official languages (<a2_0>Russian<a2_0/> being the other one). As with <a3_0>Latvia<a3_0/> many immigrants entered Estonia under Soviet encouragement. In the second half of the 1970s, the <a4_0><b7_0>pressure of bilingualism<b7_0/><a4_0/> (for Estonians) intensified, resulting in widespread knowledge of <b8_0>Russian<b8_0/> throughout the country. The <b9_0>Russian<b9_0/> language was termed as ‘the language of friendship of nations’ and was taught to Estonian children, sometimes as early as in kindergarten. Although teaching Estonian to non-Estonians in schools was compulsory, in practice learning the language was often considered unnecessary.
